attributes.action: The government should publish in full the notes of communications between Blair and Bush in the run up to the Iraq War
attributes.additional_details: Notes taken by civil servants of face to face and telephone conversations between Tony Blair and George Bush in the run up to the Iraq War should provide a clear insight in the decision-making that led to the war.  In a democracy it is essential that elected politicians remain fully accountable for their actions. Excluding the views of the US president (and using gists or limited quotations for the remainder) creates a clear risk that key evidence will be distorted or suppressed.
